name: Jackalope
notes: Common prey demon (hare with antlers); considered too weak for serious combat

name: Pyrausta
notes: Lizard–insect hybrid with chameleon wings; extremely rare

name: Lesser Mite
notes: Most common demon in Hominum’s part of the ether – ubiquitous food source and scout

name: Scarab Mite
notes: Large beetle demon; powerful mandibles and paralytic sting, used by summoners as scouts

name: Will-o’-Wisp
notes: Blue-green elemental glowworm; leads prey into traps and drains blood

name: Lavellan
notes: Venomous rat-like demon; common among Orc shamans (swamp habitat)

name: Baku
notes: Tapir-like demon (tiger-striped, elephant trunk); herbivore prey, not used by most summoners

name: Damsel (Wyvern)
notes: Giant dragonfly demon with potent sting; common throughout the known ether

name: Kamaitachi
notes: Large weasel demon with bone claws; relatively common in the orcish part of the ether, attacks Hominum’s front lines

name: Kappa
notes: Aquatic frog-toad demon; common among water demons but weak (prey to sharks)

name: Bildad
notes: Venomous swamp demon; rare amphibious creature with paralyzing spurs

name: Coatl
notes: Feathered serpent demon; glides from trees and uses poison to constrict prey

name: Criosphinx
notes: Small lion-ram hybrid; smaller cousin of the Manticore/Chimera

name: Gryphowl
notes: Cat-owl demon, related to griffins; extremely rare and intelligent

name: Gunni
notes: Bear-sized wombat demon; fairly common burrower with digging claws

name: Lutra
notes: Otter-like demon with spiked tail; lives in lakes/rivers (avid swimmer)

name: Ropen
notes: Flying bat–bird hybrid with long beak; medium predator in ether skies

name: Shrike
notes: Black-feathered bird demon; yearly migratory swarms in Hominum’s skies

name: Strix
notes: Four-limbed owl demon; common in ether but vicious and rarely captured

name: Veo
notes: Armadillo-hedgehog demon; rare, can roll into spiky armored ball

name: Vesp
notes: Swarm-dwelling wasp demon; very common and a favorite among Orc shamans

name: Yale
notes: Cow/deer hybrid demon; common, agile, with curving horns that spin like drills

name: Catoblepas
notes: Dangerous herbivore demon; bovine-warthog shape, breathes toxic fumes

name: Chamrosh
notes: Loyal hawk-dog demon; smaller cousin of the griffin, favored by the Celestial Corps

name: Cockatrice
notes: Dragon-like bird-lizard; large predator with talons and beak

name: Encantado
notes: Dolphin-like water demon; very rare in Hominum (only appears in its rivers)

name: Enfield
notes: Dog-sized hybrid (fox head, eagle forelegs, wolf hindlegs); rare mid-level predator

name: Kelpie
notes: Scaled sea-horse demon; amphibious predator, weak on land

name: Leucrotta
notes: Badger-like zebra demon; hunts at dusk, once common in Hominum

name: Musimon
notes: Two-headed goat-horse with four horns; used as mounts by Dragoon corps

name: Raiju
notes: Rare lightning squirrel/mongoose demon; only five have been captured in Hominum’s history

name: Salamander
notes: Fire-breathing lizard; does not exist in Hominum’s part of the ether (captured only by orcs, extremely rare)

name: Slepnir
notes: Eight-legged horse demon; legendary Dragoon mount, high speed and stamina

name: Arach
notes: Giant spider demon with web, venomous sting and bristling hairs

name: Barkling
notes: Badger-like forest demon; bark-like skin for camouflage and shooting paralytic spines

name: Hippalectryon
notes: Horse body, rooster front, taloned hind legs; uncommon Dragoon mount

name: Naga
notes: Snake-human hybrid; weak on land, has prehensile hands and catfish whiskers

name: Shrike Matriarch
notes: Queen of the shrike flock; double-sized migratory leader (carnivore)

name: Vulpid
notes: Fox-like demon with three tails; agile and related to the common Canid

name: Caladrius
notes: White dove-like elemental; rare healer (associated with winds/clouds)

name: Canid
notes: Four-eyed dog demon; varies from large dog to pony size, common carnivore

name: Felid
notes: Bipedal cat demon with four eyes; intelligent jungle predator

name: Halcyon
notes: Bird with lightning powers; most common elemental bird, but still very rare

name: Kirin
notes: Armored horse-dragon hybrid with branching antler; rare Dragoon mount

name: Phoenix
notes: Legendary firebird demon; breathes flames, inhabits volcanoes (extremely rare)

name: Polarion
notes: Ice-element bird; can freeze enemies, lives in high clouds (extremely rare)

name: Alicorn
notes: Flying unicorn; herds migrate across Hominum once per decade

name: Anubid
notes: Rare jackal-headed demon; two-legged, very agile fighter

name: Dryad
notes: Tree-like demon; can regrow limbs and heal, hides in forests

name: Enenra
notes: Floating shadow demon; drains life from those it touches

name: Golem
notes: Living stone humanoid; high durability, extremely rare

name: Hippogriff
notes: Eagle-horse demon; flies and strikes with beak/hooves (popular Celestial Corps mount)

name: Hydra
notes: Three-headed reptile; was once common in Hominum, now extremely rare

name: Lycan
notes: Wolf-man demon; stronger than Anubid but very rare in the wild

name: Sylph
notes: Misty air elemental; no physical attacks but can heal (rarest of Enenra’s kin)

name: Tarasque
notes: Six-legged tortoise demon; spiked shell (dwells in desert)

name: Tikbalang
notes: Horse-headed demon; once popular with Orc shamans, now uncommon

name: Bunyip
notes: Giant swamp rat; fur holds moss for camouflage, drowns prey

name: Nanaue
notes: Shark-like demon; favored by Orc shamans for its ferocity

name: Peryton
notes: Winged stag demon; most common flying steed for Hominum (herds migrate)

name: Sobek
notes: Bipedal crocodile demon; common in swamps/rivers, camouflages in water

name: Ahool
notes: Giant bat demon; extremely rare tracker (used by powerful Orc shamans)

name: Griffin
notes: Lion-bodied eagle demon; occasionally flies into Hominum’s skies (very rare)

name: Oni
notes: Red-skinned demon (ogre-like); strong and commonly used by veteran Orc shamans

name: Abaia
notes: Four-legged eel demon; can shock with electricity but weak on land

name: Chimera
notes: Three-headed hybrid; lion-goat-snake demon with venomous snake tail
